instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536A: What is 820-3536A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that turns on now. but has an x through the battery and says "no battery detected" if i unplug the charger with the computer on, the screen goes black but the fan continues to spin until the battery is disconnected. In diode mode i get .316 on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR>. <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> gives me 2k ohms and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> gives me 1.65k ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message:
Are you getting 3.42V on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> ?

Not a huge amount to check here.
Bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, Battery or SMC.

Also check current sense pairs
<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR>,  
<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>

Whats history of board ? liquid ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: I get 1.5 mv on SCL, SDA jumps around a lot. 2.5 ohms on <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> .4 ohms on <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> 10 ohms on <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> 10 ohms on 7122, the board looks absolutely fine, no evidence of liquid anywhere

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message:
Something is bring those data lines down.

check <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> for corrosion. Other than that disconnect battery, see if data lines get back to 3V.

Probably bad SMC, but these don't usually go bad by themselves.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> looks perfect  the SCL data line has a 1 ohm resistance to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message:
some thing is bring that data line down

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, battery or SMC. your pick.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: wasnt the battery, ill pull <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>... Also, Does this have liquid damage? I get stuff all the time in my shop that has no liquid and the ISL is bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: I cant see any liquid damage at all

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: It's probably the ISL then.. Seems to be one of the more common chips to fail randomly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: Remove ISL first and check if resistance on SCL data line goes up, if wont, SMC is bad....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: removed the isl short is gone

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: Then there you go!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: okay so new problem, now when i plug in the charger it turns on, but then shuts back off about 3 seconds later and stays off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: then you fucked something up changing the isl as it was working before this. double check your work and make sure you did not move anything out of where it should be, this happens a lot. back track all your work you have done since this issue has come up and make sure everything is in place.  also did you placed the isl in the proper position?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: when I put the isl back on it wasnt flat to the board, seems to be all fixed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: now i have a 1ohm short to ground on the same line again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: Well i guess that leaves only one component.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: pulled the isl again shorts gone again.... not sure what im doing wrong here

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: what is the resistance with ISL out?? in both data lines.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: I pulled an isl from a donor board, for some reason the new ones from the spool didnt work but that one did, computer sees the battery now, thanks for the help guys

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: Where did the ISLs come from? This happens to me from time to time and is why I like donor boards for things I can't buy directly from mouser or digikey. If from us, PM me an order number so I can get to the bottom of it!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: looks like I bought them from L2 computer in september of last year

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont detect battery
threads.message: Well there you go... L2 sells trash. Avoid them like the plaque... By from Louis or a place called Beetstech. I still get a bad one from the reel every now and then.
